str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
This; he, she, it.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A fornicator, man who prostitutes himself. From pernemi; a prostitute, i.e. a debauchee.
Unclean, impure. Impure (lewd) or specially, (demonic).
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
A covetous or avaricious person; one desirous of having more. From pleion and echo; holding more, i.e. Eager for gain.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A server (worshipper) of an image (an idol). From eidolon and the base of latreuo; an image- worshipper.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
From kleronomos; heirship, i.e. a patrimony or a possession.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From basileus; properly, royalty, i.e. rule, or a realm.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
And, even, also, namely.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
